sentence.text: Increasing evidence has shown that negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-interacting protein (response to hypoxia) plays important roles both physiologically and pathologically in humans; however, the role of WTIP in cancer is unknown.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Here, we investigated the role and mechanism of response to hypoxia in cell proliferation and tumorigenesis of non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
We report that response to hypoxia is a tumor suppressor in human NSCLC.

Moreover, ectopic overexpression of response to hypoxia dramatically inhibits cell proliferation and tumorigenesis in vitro and in vivo; conversely, depletion of WTIP expression shows the opposite effects.
